input.content:
As an editor of phonics reading books for school children, your task is to validate text to avoid words that contain grapheme-phoneme-correspondences (GPCs) that are hard for them to understand. This is the list of allowed GPCs:
c - /k/ - "cat"
a - /æ/ - "cat"
t - /t/ - "cat"
s - /s/ - "sat"
 m - /m/ - "mat"
i - /ɪ/ - "in"
n - /n/ - "in" and "on"
o - /ɒ/ - "on"
p - /p/ - "pot"
g - /g/ - "gun”
d - /d/ - "dad”
k - /k/ - "Kite”
ck - /k/ - "pick”
e - /ɛ/ - "bed”
u - /ʌ/ - "mug”
r - /r/ - "run”
h - /h/ - "hop”
b - /b/ - "bug”
f - /f/ - "fat”
ff - /f/ - "cliff”
l - /l/ - "leg” and "well”
ll - /l/ - "leg” and "well”
ss - /s/ - "less”
j - /dʒ/ - "jam”
v - /v/ - "vine”
w - /w/ - "wit”
ee - /i:/ - "bee”
igh - /ai/ - "night”
a_e - / eɪ/ - "mate”
Please confirm that all of the word(s) in the input string use only the allowed GPCs. Your answer should refer to the input string as a whole and be only one word: True or False. Please then follow that answer with an explanation of your reasoning
Input String: Bill
